info.title: Raster Foundry
info.description: An application to find, view, and analyze geospatial data at any scale

x-top-matter.title: Introduction
x-top-matter.content: The Raster Foundry API allows developers to find, view, and analyze geospatial data in Raster Foundry. As the name implies, it's especially useful for working with large raster datasets like satellite imagery. Raster Foundry is built with an openly licensed, open source code base. If you'd like to peek under the hood, make a request, or become a contributor, find us on Github.

x-top-matter.title: Authentication
x-top-matter.content: Our API identifies applications and users with JSON Web Tokens (JWT). Refresh tokens can be created in your Raster Foundry account and used to generate example requests signed with valid session tokens (detailed instructions are available here).

x-resources.name: Projects
x-resources.description: Projects are user-defined collections of scenes and are the fundamental unit that tools act on.

further-description.title: Project permissions
further-description.content:
Projects are currently private to the user that created them and cannot be discovered by other Raster Foundry users. However, projects can be shared publicly as a tiled web map with a direct link.
Project permissions will eventually expand to include making projects discoverable to all users or just users within an organization.

x-resources.name: Scenes
x-resources.description: Scenes are single or multi-image rasters where every image within the scene shares the same metadata characteristics and are always associated with a datasource. This simplest example of a scene is a single-band image like a land classification raster. The most complex example is a multi-image scene made up of multi-band images, like a pre-tiled aerial image where each tile is one piece of a larger coherent scene.

further-description.title: Scene permissions
further-description.content:
By default, imported scenes are private to the user that uploaded them and scenes generated from public data sources are discoverable by all users.
Scene permissions will eventually expand to include making imported scenes discoverable to all users or just users within an organization.

x-resources.name: Images
x-resources.description: Images are single or multi-band rasters that can be viewed and edited as a single unit but are always associated with a parent scene. They are sometimes synonymous with their parent scenes and other times just one of several images associated with their parent scenes. One common example of an image is a multispectral satellite image; another is a land classification raster.

further-description.title: Image permissions
further-description.content: Images respect the permissions applied to their parent scenes.

x-resources.name: Uploads
x-resources.description: Uploads are datasets that a user or application has attempted to upload to Raster Foundry (successfully or unsuccessfully).

further-description.title: Uploads permissions
further-description.content: All user uploads are private to that user.

x-resources.name: Datasources
x-resources.description: "Datasources contain information common to all scenes associated with them, such as the number of bands to expect in images associated with that datasource. A datasource can be specific (e.g. a particular earth observation satellite) or generic (e.g. a 3-band sensor on a UAV). All scenes must have an associated datasource." "Currently, datasources cannot be created through the API and must be requested (preferably as a Github issue in the source repository)." "In the future, users will be able to manage the creation, amendment, and deletion of datasources directly through the API. Also, users will be able to assign transformations like color correction, band composites, or color maps to datasources as a default for themselves and/or their organizations."

x-resources.name: Tokens
x-resources.description: Tokens are used to securely identify users and applications accessing the API.

x-resources.name: Tools
x-resources.description:
Tools are algorithms that can be applied to projects manually or automatically.
Tools can range from primitive statistical queries, to algebraic functions, to complex logic trees of operations happening in parallel. Tools can be constructed of other tools, custom-defined operations, or both. They can take any number of projects as inputs.

x-resources.name: Users
x-resources.description: Users and third party applications can be managed with the Users resource.

x-resources.name: Organizations
x-resources.description: Organizations are associations of users who share uniform access to permissions-protected resources.

x-resources.name: Exports
x-resources.description: Projects can be exported, but individual scenes and images cannot.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Resources to obtain, use, and delete API tokens

get.summary: Get a list of datasources
get.description:
Datasources are sensors that share common metadata, like default color corrections. Scenes from
a given datasource can be mosaiced and color corrected together.

get.summary: Get a list of uploads
get.description: The uploads API endpoint enables searching, listing, and creating new uploads.

orderingBase.name: ordering
orderingBase.description: Field to order results; meaning of label varies based on endpoint

name.name: name
name.description: name of a datasource to filter to

organization.name: organization
organization.description: UUID for organization to filter by

page.name: page
page.description: Page of results to go to

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: Number of results per page in paginated response

minCloudCover.name: minCloudCover
minCloudCover.description: Only return results with cloud cover greater than this number

maxCloudCover.name: maxCloudCover
maxCloudCover.description: Only return results with cloud cover less than this number

minAcquisitionDatetime.name: minAcquisitionDatetime
minAcquisitionDatetime.description: Only return results acquired after this datetime

maxAcquisitionDatetime.name: maxAcquisitionDatetime
maxAcquisitionDatetime.description: Only return results acquired before this datetime

minCreateDatetime.name: minCreateDatetime
minCreateDatetime.description: Only return results created after this datetime

minSunElevation.name: minSunElevation
minSunElevation.description: Only return results with sun elevation greater than this value

maxSunElevation.name: maxSunElevation
maxSunElevation.description: Only return results with sun elevation less than this value

minSunAzimuth.name: minSunAzimuth
minSunAzimuth.description: Only return results with sun elevation greater than this value

maxSunAzimuth.name: maxSunAzimuth
maxSunAzimuth.description: Only return results with sun azium greater than this value

maxCreateDatetime.name: maxCreateDatetime
maxCreateDatetime.description: Only return results created before this datetime

tags.name: tags
tags.description: Only return results that contain these tags

datasource.name: datasource
datasource.description: Only return results belonging to this datasource

month.name: month
month.description: Only return results from this month

minDayOfMonth.name: minDayOfMonth
minDayOfMonth.description: Only return results with acquisition day-of-month greater-than or equal-to this day

maxDayOfMonth.name: maxDayOfMonth
maxDayOfMonth.description: Only return results with acquisition day-of-month less-than than or equal-to this day

toolTag.name: toolTag
toolTag.description: Only return results that contain these tool tags

toolCategory.name: toolCategory
toolCategory.description: Only return results that satisfy this category

minRating.name: minRating
minRating.description: Only return results greater than this rating

maxRating.name: maxRating
maxRating.description: Only return results less than this rating

minRawDataBytes.name: minRawDataBytes
minRawDataBytes.description: Only return images larger than this amount of bytes

maxRawDataBytes.name: maxRawDataBytes
maxRawDataBytes.description: Only return images less than this amount of bytes

minResolution.name: minResolution
minResolution.description: Only return objects that have elements greater than this resolution

maxResolution.name: maxResolution
maxResolution.description: Only return objects that have elements with a resolution less than this amount

zoom.name: zoom
zoom.description: The zoom level used to split the bbox into a grid

bbox.name: bbox
bbox.description: Bounding box of the form "bbox=southwest_lng,southwest_lat,northeast_lng,northeast_lat". Delimit multiple with semicolons.

pending.name: pending
pending.description: Filter by scene's acceptance for an AOI project

owner.description: Optional during object creation, owner of an object

name.description: Human friendly label for map token

modifiedBy.description: User who most recently modified the object

organizationId.description: UUID of organization to which user belongs

device_name.description: User created identifier to track refresh tokens

id.description: Auth0 provided identifier used to delete refresh tokens

id_token.description: JSON Web Token that can be used for authenticating API requests

token_type.description: Type of token returned by using the refresh token

organizationId.description: UUID for organization that user is being created for

role.description: Role to create user with in the provided organization

count.description: number of total objects matching query

hasNext.description: True if more results can be fetched, otherwise false

hasPrevious.description: True if previous results can be fetched, otherwise false

page.description: Current page of paginated query results

name.description: The display name of the project

ingestSizeBytes.description: Size of ingested data in bytes.

dataFootprint.description: polygon for which this scene has data

sceneMetadata.description:
Metadata about the scene -- some aspects we will eventually want to nail down that will
be fairly common and/or required for scenes

metadataFiles.description:
Metadata files that should be present for processing all
images in a scene (e.g. relevant .mtl files or .xml)

cloudCover.description: Proportion of cloud coverage for scene

acquisitionDate.description: Date scene was acquired from instrument (e.g. satellite, drone)

name.description: The display name of the project

manualOrder.description: Is true if project scenes are manually ordered

isAOIProject.description: Is true if project is an area-of-interest project

sourceUri.description: URI to original source. This should include a protocol-like prefix to identify where it is located http://, s3://, etc.

rawDataBytes.description: Size of original uploaded imagery in bytes

bands.description: list of band types for image; a single band denotes a single band image, multiple bands should be listed in order (e.g if it is an RGB tiff then bands should be [red, green blue])

scene.description: Scene that image is associated with

metadataFiles.description:
Metadata files that should be present for processing all
images in a scene (e.g. relevant .mtl files or .xml)

widthPx.description: The width of the thumbnail, in pixels

sceneId.description: Scene that image is associated with

heightPx.description: The height of the thumbnail, in pixels

url.description: A client-accessible URL pointing to the image file

title.description: Title of tool displayed to users

description.description:
A long description of the tool, including is use-cases,
purpose, and any potential references

organization.description: The owning organization of the Tool

requirements.description: A brief description of requirements, including any relevant band requirements

tags.description: Tool tags associated with a tool

compatibleDatasources.description: Datasources that can be used with this geoprocessing tool

slugLabel.description: Slug label for use in urls

project.description: Project with which this run is associated

fileType.description: type of data being uploaded, limited to two options right now

projectId.description: during the import process, add scenes to a project if specified

CombinedSceneQueryParams.description: Combined query parameters for filtering scenes

SceneCorrectionParam.description: A paired scene ID and color correction parameter list

CombinedSceneCorrectionParams.description: Combined color correction parameters for multiple scenes

toolRunId.description: Optional id of a ToolRun. Specifying this will perform an RDD-AST-based export job.

stitch.description: stitch tiles into a single geotiff if possible

crop.description: crop stitched raster by provided mask if possible

stitch.description: stitch tiles into a single geotiff if possible

crop.description: crop stitched raster by provided mask if possible
